We at Odyssey Global are Hiring for Azure Cloud Engineer for one of our Renowned client with below required skills.Job Title: Sr. Azure Cloud EngineerJob Location: Fully RemoteCitizenship Status: USC/GC OnlyJob Description:The Sr. Azure Cloud Engineer is responsible for the support and maintenance of cloud infrastructure with a focus on resource optimization, organizational management and governance. This is going to be a 9-week contract positionâ€¢A Bachelor's degree is required; equivalent experience will be accepted in lieu of degree.â€¢Must have hands on experience managing Azure-based, highly redundant or resilient production systems.â€¢Must have experience with Azure Virtual Desktop Scalingâ€¢Must have experience with Azure Resource Managementâ€¢Experience in helping IT teams understand how data moves across networksâ€¢Must have experience in Azure configuration documentationâ€¢Must have experience in organizational management and governance including resource tag review, troubleshooting, and Azure backup configuration.Top Skills:â€¢Write/ run and implement a runbook in Azureâ€¢How would you test backups?â€¢Documenting network topology?â€¢Custom Azure Build Out (documentation, cradle to grave) â€“ not DevOps backgroundâ€¢Manual development (they do not want someone coming from large scale  automation.â€¢Network Diagram Creation - IP Routing/ subnetting. Enterprise App Review: â€¢ Review the 545 Enterprise apps in our Azure environment. â€¢ Document and recommend which apps should be removed based on Sign-on logs and Certification expiration records.Azure Backup Configurations:â€¢ Review Azure backup configurations. â€¢ Test file-level and VM-level restore playbook, documenting results and making recommendations where necessary.Azure Patch Management:â€¢ Plan, configure, and deploy Azure Patch management to replace WSUS. Resource Tag Review:â€¢ Review all resource tags.â€¢ Correct and update non-standardized tags.Azure Configuration Documentation:â€¢ Create documentation of current Azure environments, including Subscriptions, POCs, VNets, routing, VMs, etc.Network Diagram Creation: â€¢ Create a detailed network diagram of Azure VNET peering and routing. â€¢ This requires a fundamental understanding of IP routing and subnetting.Azure Virtual Desktop Scaling:â€¢ Configure Azure Virtual Desktop scaling.Azure Resource Management:â€¢ Perform Azure resource management duties by working with stakeholders to create and update subscriptions for projects.â€¢ Work with the change management team to document all proposed updates, access control, and security.Azure Environment Troubleshooting:â€¢ Assist with troubleshooting access to Azure resources, systems.If you or Someone in your Network are perfect,DM me or share the CV to krish@odysseyca.com.hashtag#Cloud Engineer #ITJobs# #AzureJobs#CloudEngineeringJobs#RemoteJobs#ContractJobs#AzureCertified

We at Odyssey Global are Hiring for Azure Cloud Engineer for one of our Renowned client with below required skills.Job Title: Sr. Azure Cloud EngineerJob Location: Fully RemoteCitizenship Status: USC/GC OnlyJob Description:The Sr. Azure Cloud Engineer is responsible for the support and maintenance of cloud infrastructure with a focus on resource optimization, organizational management and governance. This is going to be a 9-week contract positionâ€¢A Bachelor's degree is required; equivalent experience will be accepted in lieu of degree.â€¢Must have hands on experience managing Azure-based, highly redundant or resilient production systems.â€¢Must have experience with Azure Virtual Desktop Scalingâ€¢Must have experience with Azure Resource Managementâ€¢Experience in helping IT teams understand how data moves across networksâ€¢Must have experience in Azure configuration documentationâ€¢Must have experience in organizational management and governance including resource tag review, troubleshooting, and Azure backup configuration.Top Skills:â€¢Write/ run and implement a runbook in Azureâ€¢How would you test backups?â€¢Documenting network topology?â€¢Custom Azure Build Out (documentation, cradle to grave) â€“ not DevOps backgroundâ€¢Manual development (they do not want someone coming from large scale  automation.â€¢Network Diagram Creation - IP Routing/ subnetting. Enterprise App Review: â€¢ Review the 545 Enterprise apps in our Azure environment. â€¢ Document and recommend which apps should be removed based on Sign-on logs and Certification expiration records.Azure Backup Configurations:â€¢ Review Azure backup configurations. â€¢ Test file-level and VM-level restore playbook, documenting results and making recommendations where necessary.Azure Patch Management:â€¢ Plan, configure, and deploy Azure Patch management to replace WSUS. Resource Tag Review:â€¢ Review all resource tags.â€¢ Correct and update non-standardized tags.Azure Configuration Documentation:â€¢ Create documentation of current Azure environments, including Subscriptions, POCs, VNets, routing, VMs, etc.Network Diagram Creation: â€¢ Create a detailed network diagram of Azure VNET peering and routing. â€¢ This requires a fundamental understanding of IP routing and subnetting.Azure Virtual Desktop Scaling:â€¢ Configure Azure Virtual Desktop scaling.Azure Resource Management:â€¢ Perform Azure resource management duties by working with stakeholders to create and update subscriptions for projects.â€¢ Work with the change management team to document all proposed updates, access control, and security.Azure Environment Troubleshooting:â€¢ Assist with troubleshooting access to Azure resources, systems.If you or Someone in your Network are perfect,DM me or share the CV to krish@odysseyca.com.hashtag#Cloud Engineer #ITJobs# #AzureJobs#CloudEngineeringJobs#RemoteJobs#ContractJobs#AzureCertified

If youâ€™re stacking jobs and ghosting meetings, donâ€™t be surprised when companies start wondering if they need any of us at all.Earlier today, a buddy pinged me with this article: â€œA Gen Xer's plan to earn $800K this year across 6 remote jobs: Hiring people to be him.â€ I read it, shook my head, and thoughtâ€”man, we really need to talk about this. I know some people won't be "happy" with my take on this but: on one hand, I get it. We all want more security, more freedom, and yeah, more money. Stack a few remote jobs, outsource some tasks, keep your head down, and ride the wave while it lasts. Thereâ€™s even a part of me that respects the hustle. But hereâ€™s where I get stuck. Iâ€™m that guy sitting in the Zoom call with his camera on, actually trying to move the project forwardâ€¦ and wondering why the other guyâ€”who, letâ€™s be honest, never shows upâ€”is MIA again. Yeah, the work might get done. Eventually. Kind of. But now Iâ€™m questioning the whole setup. And if thatâ€™s the game weâ€™re playing, wouldnâ€™t it just be easier for companies to automate your job with AI? If youâ€™re not showing up as a human, why do we need you at all?I donâ€™t say that lightly. Iâ€™ve been the guy trying to get a foothold, looking for the next gig, making ends meet. And back in the day, I probably wouldâ€™ve thought this whole job stacking thing was brilliant. But now? Iâ€™ve spent enough time on the other side of the tableâ€”building teams, leading projectsâ€”to see how this stuff plays out. Itâ€™s not just "getting your bag." It makes people jaded. Hiring managers start side-eyeing anyone who wants "more" remote work. Talented folks looking for their first shot get passed over because companies are too burned to take a risk. So yeah, I get it. But we have to talk about the collateral damage here. Does this help us or hurt us in the long run?hashtag#RemoteWork hashtag#WorkCulture hashtag#TeamBuilding hashtag#SoftwareEngineering hashtag#DevOps hashtag#CyberSecurity hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#WorkLifeBalance hashtag#LeadershipDevelopment hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment



â€¦more

We at Odyssey Global are Hiring for Azure Cloud Engineer for one of our Renowned client with below required skills.Job Title: Sr. Azure Cloud EngineerJob Location: Fully RemoteCitizenship Status: USC/GC OnlyJob Description:The Sr. Azure Cloud Engineer is responsible for the support and maintenance of cloud infrastructure with a focus on resource optimization, organizational management and governance. This is going to be a 9-week contract positionâ€¢A Bachelor's degree is required; equivalent experience will be accepted in lieu of degree.â€¢Must have hands on experience managing Azure-based, highly redundant or resilient production systems.â€¢Must have experience with Azure Virtual Desktop Scalingâ€¢Must have experience with Azure Resource Managementâ€¢Experience in helping IT teams understand how data moves across networksâ€¢Must have experience in Azure configuration documentationâ€¢Must have experience in organizational management and governance including resource tag review, troubleshooting, and Azure backup configuration.Top Skills:â€¢Write/ run and implement a runbook in Azureâ€¢How would you test backups?â€¢Documenting network topology?â€¢Custom Azure Build Out (documentation, cradle to grave) â€“ not DevOps backgroundâ€¢Manual development (they do not want someone coming from large scale  automation.â€¢Network Diagram Creation - IP Routing/ subnetting. Enterprise App Review: â€¢ Review the 545 Enterprise apps in our Azure environment. â€¢ Document and recommend which apps should be removed based on Sign-on logs and Certification expiration records.Azure Backup Configurations:â€¢ Review Azure backup configurations. â€¢ Test file-level and VM-level restore playbook, documenting results and making recommendations where necessary.Azure Patch Management:â€¢ Plan, configure, and deploy Azure Patch management to replace WSUS. Resource Tag Review:â€¢ Review all resource tags.â€¢ Correct and update non-standardized tags.Azure Configuration Documentation:â€¢ Create documentation of current Azure environments, including Subscriptions, POCs, VNets, routing, VMs, etc.Network Diagram Creation: â€¢ Create a detailed network diagram of Azure VNET peering and routing. â€¢ This requires a fundamental understanding of IP routing and subnetting.Azure Virtual Desktop Scaling:â€¢ Configure Azure Virtual Desktop scaling.Azure Resource Management:â€¢ Perform Azure resource management duties by working with stakeholders to create and update subscriptions for projects.â€¢ Work with the change management team to document all proposed updates, access control, and security.Azure Environment Troubleshooting:â€¢ Assist with troubleshooting access to Azure resources, systems.If you or Someone in your Network are perfect,DM me or share the CV to krish@odysseyca.com.hashtag#Cloud Engineer #ITJobs# #AzureJobs#CloudEngineeringJobs#RemoteJobs#ContractJobs#AzureCertified

If youâ€™re stacking jobs and ghosting meetings, donâ€™t be surprised when companies start wondering if they need any of us at all.Earlier today, a buddy pinged me with this article: â€œA Gen Xer's plan to earn $800K this year across 6 remote jobs: Hiring people to be him.â€ I read it, shook my head, and thoughtâ€”man, we really need to talk about this. I know some people won't be "happy" with my take on this but: on one hand, I get it. We all want more security, more freedom, and yeah, more money. Stack a few remote jobs, outsource some tasks, keep your head down, and ride the wave while it lasts. Thereâ€™s even a part of me that respects the hustle. But hereâ€™s where I get stuck. Iâ€™m that guy sitting in the Zoom call with his camera on, actually trying to move the project forwardâ€¦ and wondering why the other guyâ€”who, letâ€™s be honest, never shows upâ€”is MIA again. Yeah, the work might get done. Eventually. Kind of. But now Iâ€™m questioning the whole setup. And if thatâ€™s the game weâ€™re playing, wouldnâ€™t it just be easier for companies to automate your job with AI? If youâ€™re not showing up as a human, why do we need you at all?I donâ€™t say that lightly. Iâ€™ve been the guy trying to get a foothold, looking for the next gig, making ends meet. And back in the day, I probably wouldâ€™ve thought this whole job stacking thing was brilliant. But now? Iâ€™ve spent enough time on the other side of the tableâ€”building teams, leading projectsâ€”to see how this stuff plays out. Itâ€™s not just "getting your bag." It makes people jaded. Hiring managers start side-eyeing anyone who wants "more" remote work. Talented folks looking for their first shot get passed over because companies are too burned to take a risk. So yeah, I get it. But we have to talk about the collateral damage here. Does this help us or hurt us in the long run?hashtag#RemoteWork hashtag#WorkCulture hashtag#TeamBuilding hashtag#SoftwareEngineering hashtag#DevOps hashtag#CyberSecurity hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#WorkLifeBalance hashtag#LeadershipDevelopment hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment



â€¦more

We at Odyssey Global are Hiring for Azure Cloud Engineer for one of our Renowned client with below required skills.Job Title: Sr. Azure Cloud EngineerJob Location: Fully RemoteCitizenship Status: USC/GC OnlyJob Description:The Sr. Azure Cloud Engineer is responsible for the support and maintenance of cloud infrastructure with a focus on resource optimization, organizational management and governance. This is going to be a 9-week contract positionâ€¢A Bachelor's degree is required; equivalent experience will be accepted in lieu of degree.â€¢Must have hands on experience managing Azure-based, highly redundant or resilient production systems.â€¢Must have experience with Azure Virtual Desktop Scalingâ€¢Must have experience with Azure Resource Managementâ€¢Experience in helping IT teams understand how data moves across networksâ€¢Must have experience in Azure configuration documentationâ€¢Must have experience in organizational management and governance including resource tag review, troubleshooting, and Azure backup configuration.Top Skills:â€¢Write/ run and implement a runbook in Azureâ€¢How would you test backups?â€¢Documenting network topology?â€¢Custom Azure Build Out (documentation, cradle to grave) â€“ not DevOps backgroundâ€¢Manual development (they do not want someone coming from large scale  automation.â€¢Network Diagram Creation - IP Routing/ subnetting. Enterprise App Review: â€¢ Review the 545 Enterprise apps in our Azure environment. â€¢ Document and recommend which apps should be removed based on Sign-on logs and Certification expiration records.Azure Backup Configurations:â€¢ Review Azure backup configurations. â€¢ Test file-level and VM-level restore playbook, documenting results and making recommendations where necessary.Azure Patch Management:â€¢ Plan, configure, and deploy Azure Patch management to replace WSUS. Resource Tag Review:â€¢ Review all resource tags.â€¢ Correct and update non-standardized tags.Azure Configuration Documentation:â€¢ Create documentation of current Azure environments, including Subscriptions, POCs, VNets, routing, VMs, etc.Network Diagram Creation: â€¢ Create a detailed network diagram of Azure VNET peering and routing. â€¢ This requires a fundamental understanding of IP routing and subnetting.Azure Virtual Desktop Scaling:â€¢ Configure Azure Virtual Desktop scaling.Azure Resource Management:â€¢ Perform Azure resource management duties by working with stakeholders to create and update subscriptions for projects.â€¢ Work with the change management team to document all proposed updates, access control, and security.Azure Environment Troubleshooting:â€¢ Assist with troubleshooting access to Azure resources, systems.If you or Someone in your Network are perfect,DM me or share the CV to krish@odysseyca.com.hashtag#Cloud Engineer #ITJobs# #AzureJobs#CloudEngineeringJobs#RemoteJobs#ContractJobs#AzureCertified

If youâ€™re stacking jobs and ghosting meetings, donâ€™t be surprised when companies start wondering if they need any of us at all.Earlier today, a buddy pinged me with this article: â€œA Gen Xer's plan to earn $800K this year across 6 remote jobs: Hiring people to be him.â€ I read it, shook my head, and thoughtâ€”man, we really need to talk about this. I know some people won't be "happy" with my take on this but: on one hand, I get it. We all want more security, more freedom, and yeah, more money. Stack a few remote jobs, outsource some tasks, keep your head down, and ride the wave while it lasts. Thereâ€™s even a part of me that respects the hustle. But hereâ€™s where I get stuck. Iâ€™m that guy sitting in the Zoom call with his camera on, actually trying to move the project forwardâ€¦ and wondering why the other guyâ€”who, letâ€™s be honest, never shows upâ€”is MIA again. Yeah, the work might get done. Eventually. Kind of. But now Iâ€™m questioning the whole setup. And if thatâ€™s the game weâ€™re playing, wouldnâ€™t it just be easier for companies to automate your job with AI? If youâ€™re not showing up as a human, why do we need you at all?I donâ€™t say that lightly. Iâ€™ve been the guy trying to get a foothold, looking for the next gig, making ends meet. And back in the day, I probably wouldâ€™ve thought this whole job stacking thing was brilliant. But now? Iâ€™ve spent enough time on the other side of the tableâ€”building teams, leading projectsâ€”to see how this stuff plays out. Itâ€™s not just "getting your bag." It makes people jaded. Hiring managers start side-eyeing anyone who wants "more" remote work. Talented folks looking for their first shot get passed over because companies are too burned to take a risk. So yeah, I get it. But we have to talk about the collateral damage here. We at Odyssey Global are Hiring for Azure Cloud Engineer for one of our Renowned client with below required skills.Job Title: Sr. Azure Cloud EngineerJob Location: Fully RemoteCitizenship Status: USC/GC OnlyJob Description:The Sr. Azure Cloud Engineer is responsible for the support and maintenance of cloud infrastructure with a focus on resource optimization, organizational management and governance. This is going to be a 9-week contract positionâ€¢A Bachelor's degree is required; equivalent experience will be accepted in lieu of degree.â€¢Must have hands on experience managing Azure-based, highly redundant or resilient production systems.â€¢Must have experience with Azure Virtual Desktop Scalingâ€¢Must have experience with Azure Resource Managementâ€¢Experience in helping IT teams understand how data moves across networksâ€¢Must have experience in Azure configuration documentationâ€¢Must have experience in organizational management and governance including resource tag review, troubleshooting, and Azure backup configuration.Top Skills:â€¢Write/ run and implement a runbook in Azureâ€¢How would you test backups?â€¢Documenting network topology?â€¢Custom Azure Build Out (documentation, cradle to grave) â€“ not DevOps backgroundâ€¢Manual development (they do not want someone coming from large scale  automation.â€¢Network Diagram Creation - IP Routing/ subnetting. Enterprise App Review: â€¢ Review the 545 Enterprise apps in our Azure environment. â€¢ Document and recommend which apps should be removed based on Sign-on logs and Certification expiration records.Azure Backup Configurations:â€¢ Review Azure backup configurations. â€¢ Test file-level and VM-level restore playbook, documenting results and making recommendations where necessary.Azure Patch Management:â€¢ Plan, configure, and deploy Azure Patch management to replace WSUS. Resource Tag Review:â€¢ Review all resource tags.â€¢ Correct and update non-standardized tags.Azure Configuration Documentation:â€¢ Create documentation of current Azure environments, including Subscriptions, POCs, VNets, routing, VMs, etc.Network Diagram Creation: â€¢ Create a detailed network diagram of Azure VNET peering and routing. â€¢ This requires a fundamental understanding of IP routing and subnetting.Azure Virtual Desktop Scaling:â€¢ Configure Azure Virtual Desktop scaling.Azure Resource Management:â€¢ Perform Azure resource management duties by working with stakeholders to create and update subscriptions for projects.â€¢ Work with the change management team to document all proposed updates, access control, and security.Azure Environment Troubleshooting:â€¢ Assist with troubleshooting access to Azure resources, systems.If you or Someone in your Network are perfect,DM me or share the CV to krish@odysseyca.com.hashtag#Cloud Engineer #ITJobs# #AzureJobs#CloudEngineeringJobs#RemoteJobs#ContractJobs#AzureCertified

If youâ€™re stacking jobs and ghosting meetings, donâ€™t be surprised when companies start wondering if they need any of us at all.Earlier today, a buddy pinged me with this article: â€œA Gen Xer's plan to earn $800K this year across 6 remote jobs: Hiring people to be him.â€ I read it, shook my head, and thoughtâ€”man, we really need to talk about this. I know some people won't be "happy" with my take on this but: on one hand, I get it. We all want more security, more freedom, and yeah, more money. Stack a few remote jobs, outsource some tasks, keep your head down, and ride the wave while it lasts. Thereâ€™s even a part of me that respects the hustle. But hereâ€™s where I get stuck. Iâ€™m that guy sitting in the Zoom call with his camera on, actually trying to move the project forwardâ€¦ and wondering why the other guyâ€”who, letâ€™s be honest, never shows upâ€”is MIA again. Yeah, the work might get done. Eventually. Kind of. But now Iâ€™m questioning the whole setup. And if thatâ€™s the game weâ€™re playing, wouldnâ€™t it just be easier for companies to automate your job with AI? If youâ€™re not showing up as a human, why do we need you at all?I donâ€™t say that lightly. Iâ€™ve been the guy trying to get a foothold, looking for the next gig, making ends meet. And back in the day, I probably wouldâ€™ve thought this whole job stacking thing was brilliant. But now? Iâ€™ve spent enough time on the other side of the tableâ€”building teams, leading projectsâ€”to see how this stuff plays out. Itâ€™s not just "getting your bag." It makes people jaded. Hiring managers start side-eyeing anyone who wants "more" remote work. Talented folks looking for their first shot get passed over because companies are too burned to take a risk. So yeah, I get it. But we have to talk about the collateral damage here. Does this help us or hurt us in the long run?hashtag#RemoteWork hashtag#WorkCulture hashtag#TeamBuilding hashtag#SoftwareEngineering hashtag#DevOps hashtag#CyberSecurity hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#WorkLifeBalance hashtag#LeadershipDevelopment hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment

We at Odyssey Global are Hiring for Azure Cloud Engineer for one of our Renowned client with below required skills.Job Title: Sr. Azure Cloud EngineerJob Location: Fully RemoteCitizenship Status: USC/GC OnlyJob Description:The Sr. Azure Cloud Engineer is responsible for the support and maintenance of cloud infrastructure with a focus on resource optimization, organizational management and governance. This is going to be a 9-week contract positionâ€¢A Bachelor's degree is required; equivalent experience will be accepted in lieu of degree.â€¢Must have hands on experience managing Azure-based, highly redundant or resilient production systems.â€¢Must have experience with Azure Virtual Desktop Scalingâ€¢Must have experience with Azure Resource Managementâ€¢Experience in helping IT teams understand how data moves across networksâ€¢Must have experience in Azure configuration documentationâ€¢Must have experience in organizational management and governance including resource tag review, troubleshooting, and Azure backup configuration.Top Skills:â€¢Write/ run and implement a runbook in Azureâ€¢How would you test backups?â€¢Documenting network topology?â€¢Custom Azure Build Out (documentation, cradle to grave) â€“ not DevOps backgroundâ€¢Manual development (they do not want someone coming from large scale  automation.â€¢Network Diagram Creation - IP Routing/ subnetting. Enterprise App Review: â€¢ Review the 545 Enterprise apps in our Azure environment. â€¢ Document and recommend which apps should be removed based on Sign-on logs and Certification expiration records.Azure Backup Configurations:â€¢ Review Azure backup configurations. â€¢ Test file-level and VM-level restore playbook, documenting results and making recommendations where necessary.Azure Patch Management:â€¢ Plan, configure, and deploy Azure Patch management to replace WSUS. Resource Tag Review:â€¢ Review all resource tags.â€¢ Correct and update non-standardized tags.Azure Configuration Documentation:â€¢ Create documentation of current Azure environments, including Subscriptions, POCs, VNets, routing, VMs, etc.Network Diagram Creation: â€¢ Create a detailed network diagram of Azure VNET peering and routing. â€¢ This requires a fundamental understanding of IP routing and subnetting.Azure Virtual Desktop Scaling:â€¢ Configure Azure Virtual Desktop scaling.Azure Resource Management:â€¢ Perform Azure resource management duties by working with stakeholders to create and update subscriptions for projects.â€¢ Work with the change management team to document all proposed updates, access control, and security.Azure Environment Troubleshooting:â€¢ Assist with troubleshooting access to Azure resources, systems.If you or Someone in your Network are perfect,DM me or share the CV to krish@odysseyca.com.hashtag#Cloud Engineer #ITJobs# #AzureJobs#CloudEngineeringJobs#RemoteJobs#ContractJobs#AzureCertified

If youâ€™re stacking jobs and ghosting meetings, donâ€™t be surprised when companies start wondering if they need any of us at all.Earlier today, a buddy pinged me with this article: â€œA Gen Xer's plan to earn $800K this year across 6 remote jobs: Hiring people to be him.â€ I read it, shook my head, and thoughtâ€”man, we really need to talk about this. I know some people won't be "happy" with my take on this but: on one hand, I get it. We all want more security, more freedom, and yeah, more money. Stack a few remote jobs, outsource some tasks, keep your head down, and ride the wave while it lasts. Thereâ€™s even a part of me that respects the hustle. But hereâ€™s where I get stuck. Iâ€™m that guy sitting in the Zoom call with his camera on, actually trying to move the project forwardâ€¦ and wondering why the other guyâ€”who, letâ€™s be honest, never shows upâ€”is MIA again. Yeah, the work might get done. Eventually. Kind of. But now Iâ€™m questioning the whole setup. And if thatâ€™s the game weâ€™re playing, wouldnâ€™t it just be easier for companies to automate your job with AI? If youâ€™re not showing up as a human, why do we need you at all?I donâ€™t say that lightly. Iâ€™ve been the guy trying to get a foothold, looking for the next gig, making ends meet. And back in the day, I probably wouldâ€™ve thought this whole job stacking thing was brilliant. But now? Iâ€™ve spent enough time on the other side of the tableâ€”building teams, leading projectsâ€”to see how this stuff plays out. Itâ€™s not just "getting your bag." It makes people jaded. Hiring managers start side-eyeing anyone who wants "more" remote work. Talented folks looking for their first shot get passed over because companies are too burned to take a risk. So yeah, I get it. But we have to talk about the collateral damage here. Does this help us or hurt us in the long run?hashtag#RemoteWork hashtag#WorkCulture hashtag#TeamBuilding hashtag#SoftwareEngineering hashtag#DevOps hashtag#CyberSecurity hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#WorkLifeBalance hashtag#LeadershipDevelopment hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment



â€¦more

We at Odyssey Global are Hiring for Azure Cloud Engineer for one of our Renowned client with below required skills.Job Title: Sr. Azure Cloud EngineerJob Location: Fully RemoteCitizenship Status: USC/GC OnlyJob Description:The Sr. Azure Cloud Engineer is responsible for the support and maintenance of cloud infrastructure with a focus on resource optimization, organizational management and governance. This is going to be a 9-week contract positionâ€¢A Bachelor's degree is required; equivalent experience will be accepted in lieu of degree.â€¢Must have hands on experience managing Azure-based, highly redundant or resilient production systems.â€¢Must have experience with Azure Virtual Desktop Scalingâ€¢Must have experience with Azure Resource Managementâ€¢Experience in helping IT teams understand how data moves across networksâ€¢Must have experience in Azure configuration documentationâ€¢Must have experience in organizational management and governance including resource tag review, troubleshooting, and Azure backup configuration.Top Skills:â€¢Write/ run and implement a runbook in Azureâ€¢How would you test backups?â€¢Documenting network topology?â€¢Custom Azure Build Out (documentation, cradle to grave) â€“ not DevOps backgroundâ€¢Manual development (they do not want someone coming from large scale  automation.â€¢Network Diagram Creation - IP Routing/ subnetting. Enterprise App Review: â€¢ Review the 545 Enterprise apps in our Azure environment. â€¢ Document and recommend which apps should be removed based on Sign-on logs and Certification expiration records.Azure Backup Configurations:â€¢ Review Azure backup configurations. â€¢ Test file-level and VM-level restore playbook, documenting results and making recommendations where necessary.Azure Patch Management:â€¢ Plan, configure, and deploy Azure Patch management to replace WSUS. Resource Tag Review:â€¢ Review all resource tags.â€¢ Correct and update non-standardized tags.Azure Configuration Documentation:â€¢ Create documentation of current Azure environments, including Subscriptions, POCs, VNets, routing, VMs, etc.Network Diagram Creation: â€¢ Create a detailed network diagram of Azure VNET peering and routing. â€¢ This requires a fundamental understanding of IP routing and subnetting.Azure Virtual Desktop Scaling:â€¢ Configure Azure Virtual Desktop scaling.Azure Resource Management:â€¢ Perform Azure resource management duties by working with stakeholders to create and update subscriptions for projects.â€¢ Work with the change management team to document all proposed updates, access control, and security.Azure Environment Troubleshooting:â€¢ Assist with troubleshooting access to Azure resources, systems.If you or Someone in your Network are perfect,DM me or share the CV to krish@odysseyca.com.hashtag#Cloud Engineer #ITJobs# #AzureJobs#CloudEngineeringJobs#RemoteJobs#ContractJobs#AzureCertified

If youâ€™re stacking jobs and ghosting meetings, donâ€™t be surprised when companies start wondering if they need any of us at all.Earlier today, a buddy pinged me with this article: â€œA Gen Xer's plan to earn $800K this year across 6 remote jobs: Hiring people to be him.â€ I read it, shook my head, and thoughtâ€”man, we really need to talk about this. I know some people won't be "happy" with my take on this but: on one hand, I get it. We all want more security, more freedom, and yeah, more money. Stack a few remote jobs, outsource some tasks, keep your head down, and ride the wave while it lasts. Thereâ€™s even a part of me that respects the hustle. But hereâ€™s where I get stuck. Iâ€™m that guy sitting in the Zoom call with his camera on, actually trying to move the project forwardâ€¦ and wondering why the other guyâ€”who, letâ€™s be honest, never shows upâ€”is MIA again. Yeah, the work might get done. Eventually. Kind of. But now Iâ€™m questioning the whole setup. And if thatâ€™s the game weâ€™re playing, wouldnâ€™t it just be easier for companies to automate your job with AI? If youâ€™re not showing up as a human, why do we need you at all?I donâ€™t say that lightly. Iâ€™ve been the guy trying to get a foothold, looking for the next gig, making ends meet. And back in the day, I probably wouldâ€™ve thought this whole job stacking thing was brilliant. But now? Iâ€™ve spent enough time on the other side of the tableâ€”building teams, leading projectsâ€”to see how this stuff plays out. Itâ€™s not just "getting your bag." It makes people jaded. Hiring managers start side-eyeing anyone who wants "more" remote work. Talented folks looking for their first shot get passed over because companies are too burned to take a risk. So yeah, I get it. But we have to talk about the collateral damage here. Does this help us or hurt us in the long run?hashtag#RemoteWork hashtag#WorkCulture hashtag#TeamBuilding hashtag#SoftwareEngineering hashtag#DevOps hashtag#CyberSecurity hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#WorkLifeBalance hashtag#LeadershipDevelopment hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment

Why You Should Hire Me as Your Next IT EngineerğŸ”¹ My Journey in IT EngineeringFrom the beginning of my career, I have been passionate about technology, security, and automation. I started as an IT professional managing servers and troubleshooting network issues. Over time, I dived into DevSecOps and Cloud Computing, gaining expertise in AWS, Azure, Linux Administration, CI/CD pipelines, and Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Terraform and Ansible.Throughout my journey, I have worked on streamlining IT operations, automating deployments, and strengthening cybersecurity measures. My goal has always been to create IT solutions that are not only efficient and scalable but also secure and resilient.ğŸ”¹ What Makes Me Different?Many IT engineers can fix problems, but I focus on preventing them before they occur. We at Odyssey Global are Hiring for Azure Cloud Engineer for one of our Renowned client with below required skills.Job Title: Sr. Azure Cloud EngineerJob Location: Fully RemoteCitizenship Status: USC/GC OnlyJob Description:The Sr. Azure Cloud Engineer is responsible for the support and maintenance of cloud infrastructure with a focus on resource optimization, organizational management and governance. This is going to be a 9-week contract positionâ€¢A Bachelor's degree is required; equivalent experience will be accepted in lieu of degree.â€¢Must have hands on experience managing Azure-based, highly redundant or resilient production systems.â€¢Must have experience with Azure Virtual Desktop Scalingâ€¢Must have experience with Azure Resource Managementâ€¢Experience in helping IT teams understand how data moves across networksâ€¢Must have experience in Azure configuration documentationâ€¢Must have experience in organizational management and governance including resource tag review, troubleshooting, and Azure backup configuration.Top Skills:â€¢Write/ run and implement a runbook in Azureâ€¢How would you test backups?â€¢Documenting network topology?â€¢Custom Azure Build Out (documentation, cradle to grave) â€“ not DevOps backgroundâ€¢Manual development (they do not want someone coming from large scale  automation.â€¢Network Diagram Creation - IP Routing/ subnetting. Enterprise App Review: â€¢ Review the 545 Enterprise apps in our Azure environment. â€¢ Document and recommend which apps should be removed based on Sign-on logs and Certification expiration records.Azure Backup Configurations:â€¢ Review Azure backup configurations. â€¢ Test file-level and VM-level restore playbook, documenting results and making recommendations where necessary.Azure Patch Management:â€¢ Plan, configure, and deploy Azure Patch management to replace WSUS. Resource Tag Review:â€¢ Review all resource tags.â€¢ Correct and update non-standardized tags.Azure Configuration Documentation:â€¢ Create documentation of current Azure environments, including Subscriptions, POCs, VNets, routing, VMs, etc.Network Diagram Creation: â€¢ Create a detailed network diagram of Azure VNET peering and routing. â€¢ This requires a fundamental understanding of IP routing and subnetting.Azure Virtual Desktop Scaling:â€¢ Configure Azure Virtual Desktop scaling.Azure Resource Management:â€¢ Perform Azure resource management duties by working with stakeholders to create and update subscriptions for projects.â€¢ Work with the change management team to document all proposed updates, access control, and security.Azure Environment Troubleshooting:â€¢ Assist with troubleshooting access to Azure resources, systems.If you or Someone in your Network are perfect,DM me or share the CV to krish@odysseyca.com.hashtag#Cloud Engineer #ITJobs# #AzureJobs#CloudEngineeringJobs#RemoteJobs#ContractJobs#AzureCertified

If youâ€™re stacking jobs and ghosting meetings, donâ€™t be surprised when companies start wondering if they need any of us at all.Earlier today, a buddy pinged me with this article: â€œA Gen Xer's plan to earn $800K this year across 6 remote jobs: Hiring people to be him.â€ I read it, shook my head, and thoughtâ€”man, we really need to talk about this. I know some people won't be "happy" with my take on this but: on one hand, I get it. We all want more security, more freedom, and yeah, more money. Stack a few remote jobs, outsource some tasks, keep your head down, and ride the wave while it lasts. Thereâ€™s even a part of me that respects the hustle. But hereâ€™s where I get stuck. Iâ€™m that guy sitting in the Zoom call with his camera on, actually trying to move the project forwardâ€¦ and wondering why the other guyâ€”who, letâ€™s be honest, never shows upâ€”is MIA again. Yeah, the work might get done. Eventually. Kind of. But now Iâ€™m questioning the whole setup. And if thatâ€™s the game weâ€™re playing, wouldnâ€™t it just be easier for companies to automate your job with AI? If youâ€™re not showing up as a human, why do we need you at all?I donâ€™t say that lightly. Iâ€™ve been the guy trying to get a foothold, looking for the next gig, making ends meet. And back in the day, I probably wouldâ€™ve thought this whole job stacking thing was brilliant. But now? Iâ€™ve spent enough time on the other side of the tableâ€”building teams, leading projectsâ€”to see how this stuff plays out. Itâ€™s not just "getting your bag." It makes people jaded. Hiring managers start side-eyeing anyone who wants "more" remote work. Talented folks looking for their first shot get passed over because companies are too burned to take a risk. So yeah, I get it. But we have to talk about the collateral damage here. Does this help us or hurt us in the long run?hashtag#RemoteWork hashtag#WorkCulture hashtag#TeamBuilding hashtag#SoftwareEngineering hashtag#DevOps hashtag#CyberSecurity hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#WorkLifeBalance hashtag#LeadershipDevelopment hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment

Why You Should Hire Me as Your Next IT EngineerğŸ”¹ My Journey in IT EngineeringFrom the beginning of my career, I have been passionate about technology, security, and automation. I started as an IT professional managing servers and troubleshooting network issues. Over time, I dived into DevSecOps and Cloud Computing, gaining expertise in AWS, Azure, Linux Administration, CI/CD pipelines, and Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Terraform and Ansible.Throughout my journey, I have worked on streamlining IT operations, automating deployments, and strengthening cybersecurity measures. My goal has always been to create IT solutions that are not only efficient and scalable but also secure and resilient.ğŸ”¹ What Makes Me Different?Many IT engineers can fix problems, but I focus on preventing them before they occur. We at Odyssey Global are Hiring for Azure Cloud Engineer for one of our Renowned client with below required skills.Job Title: Sr. Azure Cloud EngineerJob Location: Fully RemoteCitizenship Status: USC/GC OnlyJob Description:The Sr. Azure Cloud Engineer is responsible for the support and maintenance of cloud infrastructure with a focus on resource optimization, organizational management and governance. This is going to be a 9-week contract positionâ€¢A Bachelor's degree is required; equivalent experience will be accepted in lieu of degree.â€¢Must have hands on experience managing Azure-based, highly redundant or resilient production systems.â€¢Must have experience with Azure Virtual Desktop Scalingâ€¢Must have experience with Azure Resource Managementâ€¢Experience in helping IT teams understand how data moves across networksâ€¢Must have experience in Azure configuration documentationâ€¢Must have experience in organizational management and governance including resource tag review, troubleshooting, and Azure backup configuration.Top Skills:â€¢Write/ run and implement a runbook in Azureâ€¢How would you test backups?â€¢Documenting network topology?â€¢Custom Azure Build Out (documentation, cradle to grave) â€“ not DevOps backgroundâ€¢Manual development (they do not want someone coming from large scale  automation.â€¢Network Diagram Creation - IP Routing/ subnetting. Enterprise App Review: â€¢ Review the 545 Enterprise apps in our Azure environment. â€¢ Document and recommend which apps should be removed based on Sign-on logs and Certification expiration records.Azure Backup Configurations:â€¢ Review Azure backup configurations. â€¢ Test file-level and VM-level restore playbook, documenting results and making recommendations where necessary.Azure Patch Management:â€¢ Plan, configure, and deploy Azure Patch management to replace WSUS. Resource Tag Review:â€¢ Review all resource tags.â€¢ Correct and update non-standardized tags.Azure Configuration Documentation:â€¢ Create documentation of current Azure environments, including Subscriptions, POCs, VNets, routing, VMs, etc.Network Diagram Creation: â€¢ Create a detailed network diagram of Azure VNET peering and routing. â€¢ This requires a fundamental understanding of IP routing and subnetting.Azure Virtual Desktop Scaling:â€¢ Configure Azure Virtual Desktop scaling.Azure Resource Management:â€¢ Perform Azure resource management duties by working with stakeholders to create and update subscriptions for projects.â€¢ Work with the change management team to document all proposed updates, access control, and security.Azure Environment Troubleshooting:â€¢ Assist with troubleshooting access to Azure resources, systems.If you or Someone in your Network are perfect,DM me or share the CV to krish@odysseyca.com.hashtag#Cloud Engineer #ITJobs# #AzureJobs#CloudEngineeringJobs#RemoteJobs#ContractJobs#AzureCertified

If youâ€™re stacking jobs and ghosting meetings, donâ€™t be surprised when companies start wondering if they need any of us at all.Earlier today, a buddy pinged me with this article: â€œA Gen Xer's plan to earn $800K this year across 6 remote jobs: Hiring people to be him.â€ I read it, shook my head, and thoughtâ€”man, we really need to talk about this. I know some people won't be "happy" with my take on this but: on one hand, I get it. We all want more security, more freedom, and yeah, more money. Stack a few remote jobs, outsource some tasks, keep your head down, and ride the wave while it lasts. Thereâ€™s even a part of me that respects the hustle. But hereâ€™s where I get stuck. Iâ€™m that guy sitting in the Zoom call with his camera on, actually trying to move the project forwardâ€¦ and wondering why the other guyâ€”who, letâ€™s be honest, never shows upâ€”is MIA again. Yeah, the work might get done. Eventually. Kind of. But now Iâ€™m questioning the whole setup. And if thatâ€™s the game weâ€™re playing, wouldnâ€™t it just be easier for companies to automate your job with AI? If youâ€™re not showing up as a human, why do we need you at all?I donâ€™t say that lightly. Iâ€™ve been the guy trying to get a foothold, looking for the next gig, making ends meet. And back in the day, I probably wouldâ€™ve thought this whole job stacking thing was brilliant. But now? Iâ€™ve spent enough time on the other side of the tableâ€”building teams, leading projectsâ€”to see how this stuff plays out. Itâ€™s not just "getting your bag." It makes people jaded. Hiring managers start side-eyeing anyone who wants "more" remote work. Talented folks looking for their first shot get passed over because companies are too burned to take a risk. So yeah, I get it. But we have to talk about the collateral damage here. Does this help us or hurt us in the long run?hashtag#RemoteWork hashtag#WorkCulture hashtag#TeamBuilding hashtag#SoftwareEngineering hashtag#DevOps hashtag#CyberSecurity hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#WorkLifeBalance hashtag#LeadershipDevelopment hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment

We at Odyssey Global are Hiring for Azure Cloud Engineer for one of our Renowned client with below required skills.Job Title: Sr. Azure Cloud EngineerJob Location: Fully RemoteCitizenship Status: USC/GC OnlyJob Description:The Sr. Azure Cloud Engineer is responsible for the support and maintenance of cloud infrastructure with a focus on resource optimization, organizational management and governance. This is going to be a 9-week contract positionâ€¢A Bachelor's degree is required; equivalent experience will be accepted in lieu of degree.â€¢Must have hands on experience managing Azure-based, highly redundant or resilient production systems.â€¢Must have experience with Azure Virtual Desktop Scalingâ€¢Must have experience with Azure Resource Managementâ€¢Experience in helping IT teams understand how data moves across networksâ€¢Must have experience in Azure configuration documentationâ€¢Must have experience in organizational management and governance including resource tag review, troubleshooting, and Azure backup configuration.Top Skills:â€¢Write/ run and implement a runbook in Azureâ€¢How would you test backups?â€¢Documenting network topology?â€¢Custom Azure Build Out (documentation, cradle to grave) â€“ not DevOps backgroundâ€¢Manual development (they do not want someone coming from large scale  automation.â€¢Network Diagram Creation - IP Routing/ subnetting. Enterprise App Review: â€¢ Review the 545 Enterprise apps in our Azure environment. â€¢ Document and recommend which apps should be removed based on Sign-on logs and Certification expiration records.Azure Backup Configurations:â€¢ Review Azure backup configurations. â€¢ Test file-level and VM-level restore playbook, documenting results and making recommendations where necessary.Azure Patch Management:â€¢ Plan, configure, and deploy Azure Patch management to replace WSUS. Resource Tag Review:â€¢ Review all resource tags.â€¢ Correct and update non-standardized tags.Azure Configuration Documentation:â€¢ Create documentation of current Azure environments, including Subscriptions, POCs, VNets, routing, VMs, etc.Network Diagram Creation: â€¢ Create a detailed network diagram of Azure VNET peering and routing. â€¢ This requires a fundamental understanding of IP routing and subnetting.Azure Virtual Desktop Scaling:â€¢ Configure Azure Virtual Desktop scaling.Azure Resource Management:â€¢ Perform Azure resource management duties by working with stakeholders to create and update subscriptions for projects.â€¢ Work with the change management team to document all proposed updates, access control, and security.Azure Environment Troubleshooting:â€¢ Assist with troubleshooting access to Azure resources, systems.If you or Someone in your Network are perfect,DM me or share the CV to krish@odysseyca.com.hashtag#Cloud Engineer #ITJobs# #AzureJobs#CloudEngineeringJobs#RemoteJobs#ContractJobs#AzureCertified

If youâ€™re stacking jobs and ghosting meetings, donâ€™t be surprised when companies start wondering if they need any of us at all.Earlier today, a buddy pinged me with this article: â€œA Gen Xer's plan to earn $800K this year across 6 remote jobs: Hiring people to be him.â€ I read it, shook my head, and thoughtâ€”man, we really need to talk about this. I know some people won't be "happy" with my take on this but: on one hand, I get it. We all want more security, more freedom, and yeah, more money. Stack a few remote jobs, outsource some tasks, keep your head down, and ride the wave while it lasts. Thereâ€™s even a part of me that respects the hustle. But hereâ€™s where I get stuck. Iâ€™m that guy sitting in the Zoom call with his camera on, actually trying to move the project forwardâ€¦ and wondering why the other guyâ€”who, letâ€™s be honest, never shows upâ€”is MIA again. Yeah, the work might get done. Eventually. Kind of. But now Iâ€™m questioning the whole setup. And if thatâ€™s the game weâ€™re playing, wouldnâ€™t it just be easier for companies to automate your job with AI? If youâ€™re not showing up as a human, why do we need you at all?I donâ€™t say that lightly. Iâ€™ve been the guy trying to get a foothold, looking for the next gig, making ends meet. And back in the day, I probably wouldâ€™ve thought this whole job stacking thing was brilliant. But now? Iâ€™ve spent enough time on the other side of the tableâ€”building teams, leading projectsâ€”to see how this stuff plays out. Itâ€™s not just "getting your bag." It makes people jaded. Hiring managers start side-eyeing anyone who wants "more" remote work. Talented folks looking for their first shot get passed over because companies are too burned to take a risk. So yeah, I get it. But we have to talk about the collateral damage here. Does this help us or hurt us in the long run?hashtag#RemoteWork hashtag#WorkCulture hashtag#TeamBuilding hashtag#SoftwareEngineering hashtag#DevOps hashtag#CyberSecurity hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#WorkLifeBalance hashtag#LeadershipDevelopment hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment

We at Odyssey Global are Hiring for Azure Cloud Engineer for one of our Renowned client with below required skills.Job Title: Sr. Azure Cloud EngineerJob Location: Fully RemoteCitizenship Status: USC/GC OnlyJob Description:The Sr. Azure Cloud Engineer is responsible for the support and maintenance of cloud infrastructure with a focus on resource optimization, organizational management and governance. This is going to be a 9-week contract positionâ€¢A Bachelor's degree is required; equivalent experience will be accepted in lieu of degree.â€¢Must have hands on experience managing Azure-based, highly redundant or resilient production systems.â€¢Must have experience with Azure Virtual Desktop Scalingâ€¢Must have experience with Azure Resource Managementâ€¢Experience in helping IT teams understand how data moves across networksâ€¢Must have experience in Azure configuration documentationâ€¢Must have experience in organizational management and governance including resource tag review, troubleshooting, and Azure backup configuration.Top Skills:â€¢Write/ run and implement a runbook in Azureâ€¢How would you test backups?â€¢Documenting network topology?â€¢Custom Azure Build Out (documentation, cradle to grave) â€“ not DevOps backgroundâ€¢Manual development (they do not want someone coming from large scale  automation.â€¢Network Diagram Creation - IP Routing/ subnetting. Enterprise App Review: â€¢ Review the 545 Enterprise apps in our Azure environment. â€¢ Document and recommend which apps should be removed based on Sign-on logs and Certification expiration records.Azure Backup Configurations:â€¢ Review Azure backup configurations. â€¢ Test file-level and VM-level restore playbook, documenting results and making recommendations where necessary.Azure Patch Management:â€¢ Plan, configure, and deploy Azure Patch management to replace WSUS. Resource Tag Review:â€¢ Review all resource tags.â€¢ Correct and update non-standardized tags.Azure Configuration Documentation:â€¢ Create documentation of current Azure environments, including Subscriptions, POCs, VNets, routing, VMs, etc.Network Diagram Creation: â€¢ Create a detailed network diagram of Azure VNET peering and routing. â€¢ This requires a fundamental understanding of IP routing and subnetting.Azure Virtual Desktop Scaling:â€¢ Configure Azure Virtual Desktop scaling.Azure Resource Management:â€¢ Perform Azure resource management duties by working with stakeholders to create and update subscriptions for projects.â€¢ Work with the change management team to document all proposed updates, access control, and security.Azure Environment Troubleshooting:â€¢ Assist with troubleshooting access to Azure resources, systems.If you or Someone in your Network are perfect,DM me or share the CV to krish@odysseyca.com.hashtag#Cloud Engineer #ITJobs# #AzureJobs#CloudEngineeringJobs#RemoteJobs#ContractJobs#AzureCertified

If youâ€™re stacking jobs and ghosting meetings, donâ€™t be surprised when companies start wondering if they need any of us at all.Earlier today, a buddy pinged me with this article: â€œA Gen Xer's plan to earn $800K this year across 6 remote jobs: Hiring people to be him.â€ I read it, shook my head, and thoughtâ€”man, we really need to talk about this. I know some people won't be "happy" with my take on this but: on one hand, I get it. We all want more security, more freedom, and yeah, more money. Stack a few remote jobs, outsource some tasks, keep your head down, and ride the wave while it lasts. Thereâ€™s even a part of me that respects the hustle. But hereâ€™s where I get stuck. Iâ€™m that guy sitting in the Zoom call with his camera on, actually trying to move the project forwardâ€¦ and wondering why the other guyâ€”who, letâ€™s be honest, never shows upâ€”is MIA again. Yeah, the work might get done. Eventually. Kind of. But now Iâ€™m questioning the whole setup. And if thatâ€™s the game weâ€™re playing, wouldnâ€™t it just be easier for companies to automate your job with AI? If youâ€™re not showing up as a human, why do we need you at all?I donâ€™t say that lightly. Iâ€™ve been the guy trying to get a foothold, looking for the next gig, making ends meet. And back in the day, I probably wouldâ€™ve thought this whole job stacking thing was brilliant. But now? Iâ€™ve spent enough time on the other side of the tableâ€”building teams, leading projectsâ€”to see how this stuff plays out. Itâ€™s not just "getting your bag." It makes people jaded. Hiring managers start side-eyeing anyone who wants "more" remote work. Talented folks looking for their first shot get passed over because companies are too burned to take a risk. So yeah, I get it. But we have to talk about the collateral damage here. Does this help us or hurt us in the long run?hashtag#RemoteWork hashtag#WorkCulture hashtag#TeamBuilding hashtag#SoftwareEngineering hashtag#DevOps hashtag#CyberSecurity hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#WorkLifeBalance hashtag#LeadershipDevelopment hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment

Why You Should Hire Me as Your Next IT EngineerğŸ”¹ My Journey in IT EngineeringFrom the beginning of my career, I have been passionate about technology, security, and automation. I started as an IT professional managing servers and troubleshooting network issues. Over time, I dived into DevSecOps and Cloud Computing, gaining expertise in AWS, Azure, Linux Administration, CI/CD pipelines, and Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Terraform and Ansible.Throughout my journey, I have worked on streamlining IT operations, automating deployments, and strengthening cybersecurity measures. My goal has always been to create IT solutions that are not only efficient and scalable but also secure and resilient.ğŸ”¹ What Makes Me Different?Many IT engineers can fix problems, but I focus on preventing them before they occur. We at Odyssey Global are Hiring for Azure Cloud Engineer for one of our Renowned client with below required skills.Job Title: Sr. Azure Cloud EngineerJob Location: Fully RemoteCitizenship Status: USC/GC OnlyJob Description:The Sr. Azure Cloud Engineer is responsible for the support and maintenance of cloud infrastructure with a focus on resource optimization, organizational management and governance. This is going to be a 9-week contract positionâ€¢A Bachelor's degree is required; equivalent experience will be accepted in lieu of degree.â€¢Must have hands on experience managing Azure-based, highly redundant or resilient production systems.â€¢Must have experience with Azure Virtual Desktop Scalingâ€¢Must have experience with Azure Resource Managementâ€¢Experience in helping IT teams understand how data moves across networksâ€¢Must have experience in Azure configuration documentationâ€¢Must have experience in organizational management and governance including resource tag review, troubleshooting, and Azure backup configuration.Top Skills:â€¢Write/ run and implement a runbook in Azureâ€¢How would you test backups?â€¢Documenting network topology?â€¢Custom Azure Build Out (documentation, cradle to grave) â€“ not DevOps backgroundâ€¢Manual development (they do not want someone coming from large scale  automation.â€¢Network Diagram Creation - IP Routing/ subnetting. Enterprise App Review: â€¢ Review the 545 Enterprise apps in our Azure environment. â€¢ Document and recommend which apps should be removed based on Sign-on logs and Certification expiration records.Azure Backup Configurations:â€¢ Review Azure backup configurations. â€¢ Test file-level and VM-level restore playbook, documenting results and making recommendations where necessary.Azure Patch Management:â€¢ Plan, configure, and deploy Azure Patch management to replace WSUS. Resource Tag Review:â€¢ Review all resource tags.â€¢ Correct and update non-standardized tags.Azure Configuration Documentation:â€¢ Create documentation of current Azure environments, including Subscriptions, POCs, VNets, routing, VMs, etc.Network Diagram Creation: â€¢ Create a detailed network diagram of Azure VNET peering and routing. â€¢ This requires a fundamental understanding of IP routing and subnetting.Azure Virtual Desktop Scaling:â€¢ Configure Azure Virtual Desktop scaling.Azure Resource Management:â€¢ Perform Azure resource management duties by working with stakeholders to create and update subscriptions for projects.â€¢ Work with the change management team to document all proposed updates, access control, and security.Azure Environment Troubleshooting:â€¢ Assist with troubleshooting access to Azure resources, systems.If you or Someone in your Network are perfect,DM me or share the CV to krish@odysseyca.com.hashtag#Cloud Engineer #ITJobs# #AzureJobs#CloudEngineeringJobs#RemoteJobs#ContractJobs#AzureCertified

If youâ€™re stacking jobs and ghosting meetings, donâ€™t be surprised when companies start wondering if they need any of us at all.Earlier today, a buddy pinged me with this article: â€œA Gen Xer's plan to earn $800K this year across 6 remote jobs: Hiring people to be him.â€ I read it, shook my head, and thoughtâ€”man, we really need to talk about this. I know some people won't be "happy" with my take on this but: on one hand, I get it. We all want more security, more freedom, and yeah, more money. Stack a few remote jobs, outsource some tasks, keep your head down, and ride the wave while it lasts. Thereâ€™s even a part of me that respects the hustle. But hereâ€™s where I get stuck. Iâ€™m that guy sitting in the Zoom call with his camera on, actually trying to move the project forwardâ€¦ and wondering why the other guyâ€”who, letâ€™s be honest, never shows upâ€”is MIA again. Yeah, the work might get done. Eventually. Kind of. But now Iâ€™m questioning the whole setup. And if thatâ€™s the game weâ€™re playing, wouldnâ€™t it just be easier for companies to automate your job with AI? If youâ€™re not showing up as a human, why do we need you at all?I donâ€™t say that lightly. Iâ€™ve been the guy trying to get a foothold, looking for the next gig, making ends meet. And back in the day, I probably wouldâ€™ve thought this whole job stacking thing was brilliant. But now? Iâ€™ve spent enough time on the other side of the tableâ€”building teams, leading projectsâ€”to see how this stuff plays out. Itâ€™s not just "getting your bag." It makes people jaded. Hiring managers start side-eyeing anyone who wants "more" remote work. Talented folks looking for their first shot get passed over because companies are too burned to take a risk. So yeah, I get it. But we have to talk about the collateral damage here. Does this help us or hurt us in the long run?hashtag#RemoteWork hashtag#WorkCulture hashtag#TeamBuilding hashtag#SoftwareEngineering hashtag#DevOps hashtag#CyberSecurity hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#WorkLifeBalance hashtag#LeadershipDevelopment hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment

We at Odyssey Global are Hiring for Azure Cloud Engineer for one of our Renowned client with below required skills.Job Title: Sr. Azure Cloud EngineerJob Location: Fully RemoteCitizenship Status: USC/GC OnlyJob Description:The Sr. Azure Cloud Engineer is responsible for the support and maintenance of cloud infrastructure with a focus on resource optimization, organizational management and governance. This is going to be a 9-week contract positionâ€¢A Bachelor's degree is required; equivalent experience will be accepted in lieu of degree.â€¢Must have hands on experience managing Azure-based, highly redundant or resilient production systems.â€¢Must have experience with Azure Virtual Desktop Scalingâ€¢Must have experience with Azure Resource Managementâ€¢Experience in helping IT teams understand how data moves across networksâ€¢Must have experience in Azure configuration documentationâ€¢Must have experience in organizational management and governance including resource tag review, troubleshooting, and Azure backup configuration.Top Skills:â€¢Write/ run and implement a runbook in Azureâ€¢How would you test backups?â€¢Documenting network topology?â€¢Custom Azure Build Out (documentation, cradle to grave) â€“ not DevOps backgroundâ€¢Manual development (they do not want someone coming from large scale  automation.â€¢Network Diagram Creation - IP Routing/ subnetting. Enterprise App Review: â€¢ Review the 545 Enterprise apps in our Azure environment. â€¢ Document and recommend which apps should be removed based on Sign-on logs and Certification expiration records.Azure Backup Configurations:â€¢ Review Azure backup configurations. â€¢ Test file-level and VM-level restore playbook, documenting results and making recommendations where necessary.Azure Patch Management:â€¢ Plan, configure, and deploy Azure Patch management to replace WSUS. Resource Tag Review:â€¢ Review all resource tags.â€¢ Correct and update non-standardized tags.Azure Configuration Documentation:â€¢ Create documentation of current Azure environments, including Subscriptions, POCs, VNets, routing, VMs, etc.Network Diagram Creation: â€¢ Create a detailed network diagram of Azure VNET peering and routing. â€¢ This requires a fundamental understanding of IP routing and subnetting.Azure Virtual Desktop Scaling:â€¢ Configure Azure Virtual Desktop scaling.Azure Resource Management:â€¢ Perform Azure resource management duties by working with stakeholders to create and update subscriptions for projects.â€¢ Work with the change management team to document all proposed updates, access control, and security.Azure Environment Troubleshooting:â€¢ Assist with troubleshooting access to Azure resources, systems.If you or Someone in your Network are perfect,DM me or share the CV to krish@odysseyca.com.hashtag#Cloud Engineer #ITJobs# #AzureJobs#CloudEngineeringJobs#RemoteJobs#ContractJobs#AzureCertified

If youâ€™re stacking jobs and ghosting meetings, donâ€™t be surprised when companies start wondering if they need any of us at all.Earlier today, a buddy pinged me with this article: â€œA Gen Xer's plan to earn $800K this year across 6 remote jobs: Hiring people to be him.â€ I read it, shook my head, and thoughtâ€”man, we really need to talk about this. I know some people won't be "happy" with my take on this but: on one hand, I get it. We all want more security, more freedom, and yeah, more money. Stack a few remote jobs, outsource some tasks, keep your head down, and ride the wave while it lasts. Thereâ€™s even a part of me that respects the hustle. But hereâ€™s where I get stuck. Iâ€™m that guy sitting in the Zoom call with his camera on, actually trying to move the project forwardâ€¦ and wondering why the other guyâ€”who, letâ€™s be honest, never shows upâ€”is MIA again. Yeah, the work might get done. Eventually. Kind of. But now Iâ€™m questioning the whole setup. And if thatâ€™s the game weâ€™re playing, wouldnâ€™t it just be easier for companies to automate your job with AI? If youâ€™re not showing up as a human, why do we need you at all?I donâ€™t say that lightly. Iâ€™ve been the guy trying to get a foothold, looking for the next gig, making ends meet. And back in the day, I probably wouldâ€™ve thought this whole job stacking thing was brilliant. But now? Iâ€™ve spent enough time on the other side of the tableâ€”building teams, leading projectsâ€”to see how this stuff plays out. Itâ€™s not just "getting your bag." It makes people jaded. Hiring managers start side-eyeing anyone who wants "more" remote work. Talented folks looking for their first shot get passed over because companies are too burned to take a risk. So yeah, I get it. But we have to talk about the collateral damage here. Does this help us or hurt us in the long run?hashtag#RemoteWork hashtag#WorkCulture hashtag#TeamBuilding hashtag#SoftwareEngineering hashtag#DevOps hashtag#CyberSecurity hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#WorkLifeBalance hashtag#LeadershipDevelopment hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment

Why You Should Hire Me as Your Next IT EngineerğŸ”¹ My Journey in IT EngineeringFrom the beginning of my career, I have been passionate about technology, security, and automation. I started as an IT professional managing servers and troubleshooting network issues. Over time, I dived into DevSecOps and Cloud Computing, gaining expertise in AWS, Azure, Linux Administration, CI/CD pipelines, and Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Terraform and Ansible.Throughout my journey, I have worked on streamlining IT operations, automating deployments, and strengthening cybersecurity measures. My goal has always been to create IT solutions that are not only efficient and scalable but also secure and resilient.ğŸ”¹ What Makes Me Different?Many IT engineers can fix problems, but I focus on preventing them before they occur. We at Odyssey Global are Hiring for Azure Cloud Engineer for one of our Renowned client with below required skills.Job Title: Sr. Azure Cloud EngineerJob Location: Fully RemoteCitizenship Status: USC/GC OnlyJob Description:The Sr. Azure Cloud Engineer is responsible for the support and maintenance of cloud infrastructure with a focus on resource optimization, organizational management and governance. This is going to be a 9-week contract positionâ€¢A Bachelor's degree is required; equivalent experience will be accepted in lieu of degree.â€¢Must have hands on experience managing Azure-based, highly redundant or resilient production systems.â€¢Must have experience with Azure Virtual Desktop Scalingâ€¢Must have experience with Azure Resource Managementâ€¢Experience in helping IT teams understand how data moves across networksâ€¢Must have experience in Azure configuration documentationâ€¢Must have experience in organizational management and governance including resource tag review, troubleshooting, and Azure backup configuration.Top Skills:â€¢Write/ run and implement a runbook in Azureâ€¢How would you test backups?â€¢Documenting network topology?â€¢Custom Azure Build Out (documentation, cradle to grave) â€“ not DevOps backgroundâ€¢Manual development (they do not want someone coming from large scale  automation.â€¢Network Diagram Creation - IP Routing/ subnetting. Enterprise App Review: â€¢ Review the 545 Enterprise apps in our Azure environment. â€¢ Document and recommend which apps should be removed based on Sign-on logs and Certification expiration records.Azure Backup Configurations:â€¢ Review Azure backup configurations. â€¢ Test file-level and VM-level restore playbook, documenting results and making recommendations where necessary.Azure Patch Management:â€¢ Plan, configure, and deploy Azure Patch management to replace WSUS. Resource Tag Review:â€¢ Review all resource tags.â€¢ Correct and update non-standardized tags.Azure Configuration Documentation:â€¢ Create documentation of current Azure environments, including Subscriptions, POCs, VNets, routing, VMs, etc.Network Diagram Creation: â€¢ Create a detailed network diagram of Azure VNET peering and routing. â€¢ This requires a fundamental understanding of IP routing and subnetting.Azure Virtual Desktop Scaling:â€¢ Configure Azure Virtual Desktop scaling.Azure Resource Management:â€¢ Perform Azure resource management duties by working with stakeholders to create and update subscriptions for projects.â€¢ Work with the change management team to document all proposed updates, access control, and security.Azure Environment Troubleshooting:â€¢ Assist with troubleshooting access to Azure resources, systems.If you or Someone in your Network are perfect,DM me or share the CV to krish@odysseyca.com.hashtag#Cloud Engineer #ITJobs# #AzureJobs#CloudEngineeringJobs#RemoteJobs#ContractJobs#AzureCertified

If youâ€™re stacking jobs and ghosting meetings, donâ€™t be surprised when companies start wondering if they need any of us at all.Earlier today, a buddy pinged me with this article: â€œA Gen Xer's plan to earn $800K this year across 6 remote jobs: Hiring people to be him.â€ I read it, shook my head, and thoughtâ€”man, we really need to talk about this. I know some people won't be "happy" with my take on this but: on one hand, I get it. We all want more security, more freedom, and yeah, more money. Stack a few remote jobs, outsource some tasks, keep your head down, and ride the wave while it lasts. Thereâ€™s even a part of me that respects the hustle. But hereâ€™s where I get stuck. Iâ€™m that guy sitting in the Zoom call with his camera on, actually trying to move the project forwardâ€¦ and wondering why the other guyâ€”who, letâ€™s be honest, never shows upâ€”is MIA again. Yeah, the work might get done. Eventually. Kind of. But now Iâ€™m questioning the whole setup. And if thatâ€™s the game weâ€™re playing, wouldnâ€™t it just be easier for companies to automate your job with AI? If youâ€™re not showing up as a human, why do we need you at all?I donâ€™t say that lightly. Iâ€™ve been the guy trying to get a foothold, looking for the next gig, making ends meet. And back in the day, I probably wouldâ€™ve thought this whole job stacking thing was brilliant. But now? Iâ€™ve spent enough time on the other side of the tableâ€”building teams, leading projectsâ€”to see how this stuff plays out. Itâ€™s not just "getting your bag." It makes people jaded. Hiring managers start side-eyeing anyone who wants "more" remote work. Talented folks looking for their first shot get passed over because companies are too burned to take a risk. So yeah, I get it. But we have to talk about the collateral damage here. Does this help us or hurt us in the long run?hashtag#RemoteWork hashtag#WorkCulture hashtag#TeamBuilding hashtag#SoftwareEngineering hashtag#DevOps hashtag#CyberSecurity hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#WorkLifeBalance hashtag#LeadershipDevelopment hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment



â€¦more

We at Odyssey Global are Hiring for Azure Cloud Engineer for one of our Renowned client with below required skills.Job Title: Sr. Azure Cloud EngineerJob Location: Fully RemoteCitizenship Status: USC/GC OnlyJob Description:The Sr. Azure Cloud Engineer is responsible for the support and maintenance of cloud infrastructure with a focus on resource optimization, organizational management and governance. This is going to be a 9-week contract positionâ€¢A Bachelor's degree is required; equivalent experience will be accepted in lieu of degree.â€¢Must have hands on experience managing Azure-based, highly redundant or resilient production systems.â€¢Must have experience with Azure Virtual Desktop Scalingâ€¢Must have experience with Azure Resource Managementâ€¢Experience in helping IT teams understand how data moves across networksâ€¢Must have experience in Azure configuration documentationâ€¢Must have experience in organizational management and governance including resource tag review, troubleshooting, and Azure backup configuration.Top Skills:â€¢Write/ run and implement a runbook in Azureâ€¢How would you test backups?â€¢Documenting network topology?â€¢Custom Azure Build Out (documentation, cradle to grave) â€“ not DevOps backgroundâ€¢Manual development (they do not want someone coming from large scale  automation.â€¢Network Diagram Creation - IP Routing/ subnetting. Enterprise App Review: â€¢ Review the 545 Enterprise apps in our Azure environment. â€¢ Document and recommend which apps should be removed based on Sign-on logs and Certification expiration records.Azure Backup Configurations:â€¢ Review Azure backup configurations. â€¢ Test file-level and VM-level restore playbook, documenting results and making recommendations where necessary.Azure Patch Management:â€¢ Plan, configure, and deploy Azure Patch management to replace WSUS. Resource Tag Review:â€¢ Review all resource tags.â€¢ Correct and update non-standardized tags.Azure Configuration Documentation:â€¢ Create documentation of current Azure environments, including Subscriptions, POCs, VNets, routing, VMs, etc.Network Diagram Creation: â€¢ Create a detailed network diagram of Azure VNET peering and routing. â€¢ This requires a fundamental understanding of IP routing and subnetting.Azure Virtual Desktop Scaling:â€¢ Configure Azure Virtual Desktop scaling.Azure Resource Management:â€¢ Perform Azure resource management duties by working with stakeholders to create and update subscriptions for projects.â€¢ Work with the change management team to document all proposed updates, access control, and security.Azure Environment Troubleshooting:â€¢ Assist with troubleshooting access to Azure resources, systems.If you or Someone in your Network are perfect,DM me or share the CV to krish@odysseyca.com.hashtag#Cloud Engineer #ITJobs# #AzureJobs#CloudEngineeringJobs#RemoteJobs#ContractJobs#AzureCertified

If youâ€™re stacking jobs and ghosting meetings, donâ€™t be surprised when companies start wondering if they need any of us at all.Earlier today, a buddy pinged me with this article: â€œA Gen Xer's plan to earn $800K this year across 6 remote jobs: Hiring people to be him.â€ I read it, shook my head, and thoughtâ€”man, we really need to talk about this. I know some people won't be "happy" with my take on this but: on one hand, I get it. We all want more security, more freedom, and yeah, more money. Stack a few remote jobs, outsource some tasks, keep your head down, and ride the wave while it lasts. Thereâ€™s even a part of me that respects the hustle. But hereâ€™s where I get stuck. Iâ€™m that guy sitting in the Zoom call with his camera on, actually trying to move the project forwardâ€¦ and wondering why the other guyâ€”who, letâ€™s be honest, never shows upâ€”is MIA again. Yeah, the work might get done. Eventually. Kind of. But now Iâ€™m questioning the whole setup. And if thatâ€™s the game weâ€™re playing, wouldnâ€™t it just be easier for companies to automate your job with AI? If youâ€™re not showing up as a human, why do we need you at all?I donâ€™t say that lightly. Iâ€™ve been the guy trying to get a foothold, looking for the next gig, making ends meet. And back in the day, I probably wouldâ€™ve thought this whole job stacking thing was brilliant. But now? Iâ€™ve spent enough time on the other side of the tableâ€”building teams, leading projectsâ€”to see how this stuff plays out. Itâ€™s not just "getting your bag." It makes people jaded. Hiring managers start side-eyeing anyone who wants "more" remote work. Talented folks looking for their first shot get passed over because companies are too burned to take a risk. So yeah, I get it. But we have to talk about the collateral damage here. Does this help us or hurt us in the long run?hashtag#RemoteWork hashtag#WorkCulture hashtag#TeamBuilding hashtag#SoftwareEngineering hashtag#DevOps hashtag#CyberSecurity hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#WorkLifeBalance hashtag#LeadershipDevelopment hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment

We at Odyssey Global are Hiring for Azure Cloud Engineer for one of our Renowned client with below required skills.Job Title: Sr. Azure Cloud EngineerJob Location: Fully RemoteCitizenship Status: USC/GC OnlyJob Description:The Sr. Azure Cloud Engineer is responsible for the support and maintenance of cloud infrastructure with a focus on resource optimization, organizational management and governance. This is going to be a 9-week contract positionâ€¢A Bachelor's degree is required; equivalent experience will be accepted in lieu of degree.â€¢Must have hands on experience managing Azure-based, highly redundant or resilient production systems.â€¢Must have experience with Azure Virtual Desktop Scalingâ€¢Must have experience with Azure Resource Managementâ€¢Experience in helping IT teams understand how data moves across networksâ€¢Must have experience in Azure configuration documentationâ€¢Must have experience in organizational management and governance including resource tag review, troubleshooting, and Azure backup configuration.Top Skills:â€¢Write/ run and implement a runbook in Azureâ€¢How would you test backups?â€¢Documenting network topology?â€¢Custom Azure Build Out (documentation, cradle to grave) â€“ not DevOps backgroundâ€¢Manual development (they do not want someone coming from large scale  automation.â€¢Network Diagram Creation - IP Routing/ subnetting. Enterprise App Review: â€¢ Review the 545 Enterprise apps in our Azure environment. â€¢ Document and recommend which apps should be removed based on Sign-on logs and Certification expiration records.Azure Backup Configurations:â€¢ Review Azure backup configurations. â€¢ Test file-level and VM-level restore playbook, documenting results and making recommendations where necessary.Azure Patch Management:â€¢ Plan, configure, and deploy Azure Patch management to replace WSUS. Resource Tag Review:â€¢ Review all resource tags.â€¢ Correct and update non-standardized tags.Azure Configuration Documentation:â€¢ Create documentation of current Azure environments, including Subscriptions, POCs, VNets, routing, VMs, etc.Network Diagram Creation: â€¢ Create a detailed network diagram of Azure VNET peering and routing. â€¢ This requires a fundamental understanding of IP routing and subnetting.Azure Virtual Desktop Scaling:â€¢ Configure Azure Virtual Desktop scaling.Azure Resource Management:â€¢ Perform Azure resource management duties by working with stakeholders to create and update subscriptions for projects.â€¢ Work with the change management team to document all proposed updates, access control, and security.Azure Environment Troubleshooting:â€¢ Assist with troubleshooting access to Azure resources, systems.If you or Someone in your Network are perfect,DM me or share the CV to krish@odysseyca.com.hashtag#Cloud Engineer #ITJobs# #AzureJobs#CloudEngineeringJobs#RemoteJobs#ContractJobs#AzureCertified
